Reviews.Title: “To recommend”
Reviews.Author: Merete L Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, with great location, wonderful service and nive rooms! I will recommend this hotel to everyone going to Barcelona

Reviews.Title: “excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Vcfffff
Reviews.Content: Great customer service, very well spoken English and really helpful with everything. Only downside is that the pool is outdoor / small and its too cold to use it. Rooms were nice / clean every room a bit different though. The hotel is located right next to la ramblas only 2min walk round the corner from the main strip. would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: supergreece
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated at a very good location near the Maremagnum shopping center and La Ramblas street. Our stay was very good though. Only thing is that we asked for our bed linens to be changed and they said that they change them every three days. While this is ok, I guess that when you ask this from a 4-star hotel you expect them to be changed on your request. The WiFi was also pretty slow. Very good isolation from the outside noise since the rooms have two double windows. Finally the room didn't have a double bed as requested at the time of booking but two singles ones, well connected though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa B
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and had a great introduction to Barcelona. The location is perfect and we could easliy find our way around. We ate at the restaurant on the last night and would recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business/Vacation or a Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: conin
Reviews.Content: I initially stayed here for work during the off peak season, very central location in the Gothic area of Barcelona - plenty of activity in the surrounding streets and only a stones throw from the beach. Fine and reasonable restaurants on the street, where I even got to know some of the owners! The hotel reception staff are very friendly and helpful and they got to know me quite well, so much so that they gave me my favourite room every time I came back!!! - without asking - Now that's Customer Service. Rooms vary slightly, you can get one with no view looking on to the surrounding walls, one on the front street with balcony you can stand out on and ones that look onto the back terrace and pool - all of them were fine for me! Some rooms have bath and shower and others have just shower (big double) - you should request at booking what your preference may be. Beds comfortable, rooms very clean and tidy, mini bar, wifi. Prices vary with the season and that is understandable because of the loation. Breakfast is standard "European" and priced at 10 euro - I only took some mornings as I worked near by. I have stayed at this hotel on and off for over 4 months and two week blocks and would be more than happy to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: aichadevi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in January with my 14-year old daughter and we loved it. We had a room in the front, from which we could see the port. Because of the double windows, you don't hear any noise from the street. We loved the way the room was decorated, the beds were large and comfortable and all amenities were good: flatscreen TV (mostly spanish channels and cnn-stuff, though), large bathroom with good rainshower. The guys at the reception were really nice (one of them, Jan, is Dutch, which is of course especially nice for Dutch guests such as ourselves). The location is absolutely great. Right by the harbour, and all the nice neighbourhoods such as La Rambla, El Born, Barceloneta, Mare Magnum and the Gothic Quarter can all be reached within a few minutes walk. There are many nice tapas bars in the direct neighborhood of the hotel. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel. However, I attempted to have diner there in the hotel restaurant, but wouldn't recommend it. The waiters seem slow and incompetent and don't speak English and I didn't like the food. The only thing that could be better was that the walls between rooms are not soundproof. We could hear everything in the room next door. One night, our neighbors were watching a soccer match (with all the necessary cheering and hollering) until after midnight, but luckily it stopped immediately after we called the reception about this. The other nights were completely quiet. One other minor thing is that the temperature of the central heating could not be regulated from our room so we had to use the aircon, which is of course not very ecologic. We heartily recommend this place and would certainly come back if we ever visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Claverham
Reviews.Content: Situated near to front of port area. Very close to Las Ramblas, Gothic area and metro. Room had everything that you need but wasn't special. Very clean. Helpfull reception staff. Do not miss either of the Cathedrals or eating in the marketplace situated on the lefthand side of Las Ramles when walking away from the Port. I would go back to both the hotel and Barcelona four days was not long enough

Reviews.Title: “Nice, contemporary accomodation”
Reviews.Author: gmp123
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel with the politest receptionist i know (Angel) warmly welcoming you at the hotel with a smile and humour! Rooms were nice, clean, spacious, soundproofed, modern (as of recently refurbished), equipped with all the necessaries such as LCD TV, Air-con, safe, minibar, wardrobes, toiletries etc.. The bed and pillows were great, very comfortable, had a nice sleep! Bathroom also nice with a fancy glass door and tv/radio speakers installed in walls.... The swimming pool area was nice and cosy but swimming pool too small such as mini-pool. Hotel is situated just outside of La Rambla Square an area full of retail stores, restaurants etc.... I would recommend this hotel to people who want stay in the heart of the centre and don't mind the busy streets and noise etc....If u want a quiet area try something else...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel & Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller7481
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for a City Break spending 3 nights at the Catalonia Port. The location of the hotel is excellent being just a 2 minute walk to the bottom of La Ramblas. There are lots of small shops lining the narrow streets surrounding the hotel and the harbour is also just a couple of minutes walk away. The hotel was exceptionally clean and smart. If I had to fault something I would say that a few tiles in the bathroom could do with replacing along with the extractor fan. I was aware of building work going on in the mornings outside of the hotel but nothing dreadful by any means. I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future - it exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a true gem in the heart of old Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerRegina
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the Gothic District it allows you to walk to many of the city's hilites. Small and contemporary with a wonderful small courtyard and pool. Corner rooms give you a view of a treed square with the ocean byond. It's close to la Rambla but on a quiet steet. We travel a lot and we consider this hotel a true FIND! Great staff! Dawn & Tom

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: wobbleshill
Reviews.Content: I stayed there recently on a hen 'do' with 7 girls and we wanted to be close to the city centre. For the money we paid it was surprisingly good. (Especially as I had spent the previous 5 nights at the Hilton with family in Barcelona.) Yes it was small, but very clean and the decor was very modern and pleasant. Two minutes walk and you're on Las Ramblas or at the marina, so you're not going to be bored there. My husband travels to Barcelona every year to visit the boat show with a group of men each November and I've already recommended it to them.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Experience”
Reviews.Author: herzibopperl
Reviews.Content: We had a fabuluous stay at the hotel Catalonia Port: Very clean hotel with the most modern funiture, extremly service oriented staff in the city center of Barcelona and at the same time close to the port. Although it is practically next to the Ramblas (5 minutes walk) it is a very quiet hotel and still one of the secret tips one would get from locals. Wandering the little streets around the hotel you will find some restaurants you can´t resist. The church only 2 minutes away should be included in travel guides (but is still not).

Reviews.Title: “great position, good size rooms, all good”
Reviews.Author: jouk-7
Reviews.Content: great position, good quality hotel with decent rooms, comfy bed very clean large bathroom, at a decent price

Reviews.Title: “Nice but overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve2407
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel in a good spot but the rooms are small and the service average. We paid 280 euros a night for a twin, but it was more of the level of a 200 euro hotel, hence it is overpriced. Good points are that it is quiet regarding street noise ( but the elevator is noisy at night), and it has a little pool.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel in the Gothic quarters”
Reviews.Author: RubenHelsinki
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a narrow street in the old Gothic quarters of Barcelona. There are plenty of shops and small restaurants nearby. We stayed at the Junior suite (room 501) on the roof. It is perhaps not the best choice for disabled people, as the lift only reaches the 4th floor, and you have to take the stairs to reach the suite at the following floor. The room itself is not too spacious (20 sqm) for a junior suite but it includes a spacious with a (functioning) jacuzzi. The bathroom is modern and functional. You only have to mind the steps - there are a lot of them in the suite. A breakfast ordered beforehand costs 16 euros, but bought at the hotel you are only charged 10! And it's all the worth the price. The is a free WLAN internet with a very fast connection.

Reviews.Title: “We were SO happy to find this place!”
Reviews.Author: Gsharks
Reviews.Content: We came to the Hotel Catalonia port after deciding not to stay at the awful room we had booked in Hotel Espana. The staff was very welcoming and understanding and did their best to find us a room which turned out to be superb. Super comfortable and private we couldn't have hoped for anything better. Highly recommended if you're looking to stay in central Barcelona, near the water and you don't need a ton of amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: DeeCork
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Catalonia Port for 2 nights in May. The hotel itself is not hard to find, it is just off a square on the Passeig de Colom, which links las Ramblas with Port Vell. It is on a narrow lane next to the Gothic Quarter, so there are plenty of bars and restaurants very close by. For that reason, you may find it noisy at night (so bring ear plugs!) Metro station is a 5 min walk away. The hotel itself is nice, room is not small, bathroom well appointed. Our air conditioning worked, and you would need it as the hotel is very stuffy without it. The bed was very very hard, if you have a bad back or even if not, you will not get great sleep on these mattresses. A previous reviewer stated they got lice from the hotel...this did not happen to us, and anyway, lice is usually passed from person to person, not pillow to person. Service was good, nothing spectacular. We did not eat in the hotel. We tried to get drinks in the bar so we could drink them by the pool, but there was nobody manning the bar. So we drank elsewhere! All in all, a good hotel if you're in Barcelona for a weekend and will not be in the hotel much. However, if you are there for some R & R I would recommend somewhere with more comfort and in a quieter location. Oh, and the internet in the lobby is really, really slow. So slow that it stopped.

Reviews.Title: “I got lice. From the hotel? I do not know”
Reviews.Author: Ninav_fin
Reviews.Content: As stayed in this hotel April 2011 I got lice as a souvenir. Did I got it from the hotel? It is very much possible, but I can not be sure of it. Room 105. I hope you at the hotel management read this message and please do just about everything you can. Location of this hotel is perfect in Barcelona. I got very very good service at all times. Thank you everyone at the reception. You have been most kind and helpful staff I have seen and met during my holidays. We did have lots of problems with air conditon during our stay at the hotel. It was weekend, and all the machines stopped working after our first night. It was terribly hot in our rooms. We could hardly breath in the room. Staff at the reception couldn´t do enything for it, which I understand. Someone who was resposile for that, was not working for the weekend. That was something I do not understand, as payed fully price for the room. Tip number one: please get someone esle to do it as next time will come. Hotel itself was nice and very nicely decorated. Size of the room was good. Bathroom was tidy and very large. I would say it was in a very quiet area, allthough we had some noisy neighbours... group of men shouting at three o`clock shouting the morning in our neigbouring room (106?). Drunk, very drunk. All of them. But that´s what people di in their holidays, so what can you possibly do? other than compalin abbout it in the mornig... Breakfast was in a level of reasonable. Not very exciting, but ok. Would I come back? Possibly not. Reason is simple - lice. Barcelona is really a nice city, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: alleykatLA
Reviews.Content: Catalonia Port is a modern boutique hotel located in the old, Gothic quarter of Barcelona. It is conveniently located very close to the Ramblas and the port (convenient for cruise ship customers). The rooms itself are not very large but good enough for us. We had a superior room with a small balcony area but we didn't use it. The reception desk personnel were very helpful, friendly and nice (Thank you, Angel!) If we go back to Barcelona, we will be sure to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spanish dreams”
Reviews.Author: mixcouple
Reviews.Content: After searching many internet pages and reading many comment´s we finaly decided to stay in this hotel and believe me we havent regret it for one momenet. It´s like a family hotel where you feel at home, it´s not like other hotel where the personal is cold. No our experiense was very good, the reception was very helpful and gave us useful information about barcelona with the check in. Even the girl who cleaned our room was very nice and greeted us every day.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Amazing city. I love Spain”
Reviews.Author: Chas_Thomas79
Reviews.Content: When I decided to spend 5 days on Barcelona I ask some friend from Barcelona and they recommended me this Hotel and for to be honest if I come back to Barcelona I will go to Catalonia Port Hotel. Why? I have a lot of reasons to come back to this hotel, is very near of Las Ramblas and the city centre, is near of the museums, shopping streets, 2 minutes walking there is the underground… and very near there are some places to eat “Tapas” I have to add that the staff that is working on this Hotel is very nice and they always help me and give me good advices to visit the city. I love Spain!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quiet, value for money, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: jokeyok
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for its location, near Port Vell and its price. Will definitely return, Good staff, good location. room spacious, clean& quiet. 3 Mins walk to Rambles. Lots of cafes, restaurants and bars nearby. Good location for tour buses ect.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value”
Reviews.Author: jumbonav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a quieter street near the port-end of the Ramblas. It's about a 10 minute walk (at most) from the nearest Metro station which I took to the train station. Seems like a safe area. The staff was very nice and checked me in early. The room was spacious and was nicely appointed and even included complementary WiFi. Breakfast at the hotel was average to good. I would recommend it. Upon checking out, the staff was glad to hold my bags for a few hours while I explored the city prior to my train out of town. This service was provided for free. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, comfortable hotel in great loc at port end of Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: GreenwichNick
Reviews.Content: As I've been making business trips to Barcelona, I seem to have gradually been working my way down Las Ramblas, and on this trip I reached the port end. I think this is a good hotel for a reasonable price (around €130 per night for a double room). Not a huge room, but adequate, and well appointed, with aircon, mini-bar, good bathroom, etc. The restaurant is a bit soulless, but is handy for a quick meal in the evening as well as a reasonably priced breakfast. There is a claim for room service, but one the occasion I tried it, I got no answer (so went to the in-house restauirant). The style is modern, and while far from "de luxe", it's comfortable, clean and quiet. It's walking distances from Drassanes metro and the port, and is on the edge of the Barri Gotíc, with all that means for convenient bars and restaurants. Free (wireless) Internet, too, which was very convenient for me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very quiet!”
Reviews.Author: maze181
Reviews.Content: We had an overnight stopover in Barcelona before Honeymoon cruise departing from the nearby Barcelona port. After much searching reviews we found this superb hotel. Excellent position. Located 1 block Barcelona Harbour and 2 blocks from Las Ramblas. (and very quiet). Excellent hotel to stay if you are cruising from here. Easy 5 minute walk to cruise terminal bus stop. We dragged our bags the short distance. No need for taxi! Hotel presented very well with very attentive young man at desk. We arrived very early in the morning and were pleasantly surprised to find room was available for us... At 9.00am! Very much appreciated as we slept for 2 hours before setting off to explore the city close by. Room very dark even in middle of day with curtains drawn. Our room backed onto the inside of the hotel. Towards pool and views to other old buildings nearby. Room was very modern. Deceptive as the outside of the hotel looks old. Restaraunt and bar looked good, but we did not avail ourselves of it's service as we had Barcelona to explore. Room rate was very reasonable for a quality hotel so close to everything. We would totally recommend this hotel for short or long term visit to this magnificent city!

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location and wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Alfva
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on our flight and even though we were at the hotel just before noon we were accomodated directly upon arrival and for once (this seldom happens) the room hade already been set-up with the baby-cot we had requested for our daughter. The room (nr 406) was very spacious and was perfekt for a curious 11-months old who wants to have room to explore. Besides the hallway and the "bedroom" the room also had another little extra room (not closed off) where there was great closet space and a sitting area. Perfect place to have the baby-cot without needing to disturb her with our pacing back and forth in the room. However, we had a sneek peek into room 407 when the cleaninglady was in there and that room is not at all as big, so we were just lucky. A big plus is the great soundproofing from outside. The World Cup finals meant there was a lot of rucket outside, but in our room we had to open the doors to even hear it! There is a small pool, and for just taking a quick dip it is great! My only complaint is that the area around the pool gets way too hot during the day and our daughter was a bit too fast for us quite a few times and started shrieking as she had stepped out of the shade and onto the burning wood. The staff was really nice, helping us finding good supermarkets and supplying maps, pens and other help. I also agree with others that this is more a 4-star than a 3-star hotel. Location of the hotel is superb. You have 2-3 minutes walking distance out to La Rambla, 2 minutes down to the waterside (however it is a 20 minute walk to get to the beach) and 2 minutes to get to El Born or the Gothic Quarters although you are almost in the midst of them already! A great tip is to use the Metro, buy a T10 card which allows you to make 10 independent trips, and it only costs you (in total) about 8 Euro. This card took us all around the city for our sightseeing, the metro is easy to use - modern and not really that crowded. We had a great time in Barcelona and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, not the best location”
Reviews.Author: g_chica
Reviews.Content: The rooms in the hotel were clean, modern looking and comfortable. I travelled with one of my friends and there was more than enough room for the both of us and our suitcases. We stayed in a room that faced that street and didn't find it noisy at all. The only reason why I wouldn't rate this hotel excellent is due to its location and the service we received on the day we arrived. On the first day that we arrived, are rooms were not ready so my friend and I decided to sit in the lobby for a bit as we were tired from our early morning flight. As we were sitting there we were chatting and laughing and we could see that personnel at the front desk was becoming irrate with us. Eventually he became so fed up, he told us that our room was ready and he gave us the keys. This was the only time where I encountered unfriendliness at the hotel, the rest of the stay was fine. During the day, the location of this hotel was fine, but it was at night were I found it a bit concerning as it is on a small street that is off of a main one. At times, the shops and restaurants surrounding the hotel would close rather early, making the street dark and deserted. Nonetheless, nothing ever happened, but I was always weary walking down the street late at night.

Reviews.Title: “yes but....”
Reviews.Author: bisous
Reviews.Content: all the above reviews are right, however i would not go back its a very unpersonnal hotel, and for the price ( which are equivalent to some 4 stars ) you can find better service, in a much better and safer location, the area is bad, so bad that you can see everywhere banners hanging from balconies please clean up and make our bario gothico safer....thats what the locals want, so as a tourist there are some alleys, small street that you must avoid

Reviews.Title: “MORE 4 star hotel than 3 star”
Reviews.Author: BugsbunnyRO
Reviews.Content: We have stayed 3 nights ath this hotel and I want to tell you even from the begginig that is a very good hotel for weekends in BCN . Firstly i have read all the reviews for this hotel found on booking.com and they were accurate . Is a very nice hotel 3-4 stars . We ahd a room with a back view which was nice because are the bigger and are very quiet . The furniture is new and the INTERNET is FREE . We choose this hotel because it is very close to RAMBLA area ( 3 min walking ) and also close to the port , Aquarium and many atractions . If you look for a good hotel for a weekend it is a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel if you choose the right room”
Reviews.Author: mrodoplu
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. 4 nights in room 406 and one more week later 1 night in room 209. Our first room 406 was very bright, large (has a mini resting place aside the room),clean, comfortable and most important very silent. So we wanted to stay one more night. Our second room 209 wasn't as comfortable as the first one, but its location was bad. Rooms 206,306,406 are definetely the best ones (also 208,308,408 looks like they are in the similar position). These rooms look to the back side of the hotel and are bigger than 209,309 and 409. 209,309 and 409 rooms are located just near the elevator and are facing a little space in the middle of the building and they are darker and smaller. Only plus for these rooms are they have bathtubs. The receptionists were kind and helpfull. The location was amazing. It's near to the sea and Port Vell. Also you can reach very touristic points like Barri Gotic, La Rambla, Born and Placa de Catalunya with a short walk (max 15 min). And to Barcenoleta, Port Olimpic and Eixample with a longer walk (max 40 min).

Reviews.Title: “Robbed: unfriendly not service minded staff and expensive noisy breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Pidde
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was a nice city with great food but a lot of thieves. We got "robbed" by the hotel making us pay for an extra night (checked out an hour to late) even thoug we had been told i was ok to cancel the room. We were stuck due to the ashcloud and it was no problem to cancel the room (they were so understanding) until it was time to leave. Got no help from the hotel on how to get home. They kinda reminded me of Manuel...."Im from Barcelona, i know nothing".

Reviews.Title: “I did not use the mini bar!! Refund please!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrWhyte
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good location, shame about management. Decor very nice and clean. Modern feel to hotel. Excellent location. Reception staff helpful Slight problem with hotel not having ironing facilities in rooms but was sorted eventually. After checking out, checked my bank statement to find an extra 17 Euro charge to my credit card. Emailed hotel for an explanation and was told it was for taking a bottle of water and champagne from the mini bar. I explained I did not even open the mini bar let alone take a bottle of champagne so demanded a refund for the 17 Euros. The hotel sent a standard reply about mini bar usage and no refund. So I phoned the hotel twice from London spoke Sergei on reception to further explain, also including the cleaner came into my room just before I left, looked in the mini bar and said "nada". Sergei said it is down to the management to decide upon a refund. I told him due you really think I would ring all the way from London if I did use the mini bar. He agreed I would not. Waited a few more days still no further response. So I emailed the company directors the full story. I received a replying saying "even though we know you took the items from the mini bar we are going to refund the 17 Euros". Then the last part of the email said "We would be pleased if you chose another hotel on your next visit to Barcelona". So the Hotel Catolonia Port are calling me a liar. Great customer service? Eventually received my refund. Shame about the terrible service as the hotel itself is quite nice. But i dont fancy being charged for mini bar usage or being called a liar so will not be returning. Also avoid Club Catwalk who let in a group of white boys but turned away a group of black guys for no reason straight after. But i did see Messi score a hat trick against Valencia at the Nou Camp which made all the hassle worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Axeismyname
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic time at Catalonia Port. The stab is pleaseant and nice, it is a nice neighboorhood, but some weird people were hanging around.. But it was really great thou, the restaurants near-by were absolutely fantastic, and I ate a lot of good food. The breakfast and lunch (i did not eat dinner at the hotel) was fabolous. The rooms were nice, nice bathroom, good beds and generally nice design. So you should absolutely go to Catalonia Port!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 10ne
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was great. We could walk to almost everything. The staff was friendly and everything we had asked for in advance was ready at arrival. We even got at room with a terrace. We would recommend this hotel for other couples on a romantic holiday. Br, Kristin and Mikael

Reviews.Title: “The best 3 stars hôtel i've ever visited”
Reviews.Author: GenevaRaskolnikov
Reviews.Content: First of all, the location of the hotel is excellent. A fiew meters away from the well known remblas, the port, the beach and the old town. The rooms are big, very cosy and details oriented. The bathroom was one of the most beautiful i've seen in that category of hotels. The room was very well insonorised. The atmosphere in the hôtel is calm, peaceful and refreshing. The staff was very smilly,kind and helpful. The prices for the room, the breakfast and the room service (unbeliveable in a 3 stars) where more than corrects. Very good value hotel. A charming place in Barcelona !

Reviews.Title: “not so nice than everyone syas”
Reviews.Author: gregQuebec
Reviews.Content: Nice located hotel, but the manager have a lot of work to do to be between the best hotels in Barcelona and catalonia. I'am not sure if i will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Late notice of high extra bed cost and call in the middle of the night”
Reviews.Author: Janeroger
Reviews.Content: We honeymooned in Barcelona 13 years ago and were excited to show our 11 year-old daughter the city that we love. After traveling over 20 hours to get here from Bangkok, we arrived tired, but happy and were initially very pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel and our clean and spacious room. At check-in, however, we were surprised at the 37 Euro cost of the extra bed. The bed is a narrow and short single that folds out from a low chair. Sergey, at the front desk showed us an e-mail the hotel had sent us 5 days before our arrival, even though we had booked the room almost 2 months before. When I checked our booking, I noticed that the hotel was offering our same room with free breakfast (not included in our booking). The slightly higher than expected bed cost was a small matter that I thought could easily be resolved by offering us the free breakfast, but when I proposed this to the front desk, Sergey basically told me to get lost. Upon my request, he said he would contact management of the hotel. We had dinner and went to bed exhausted. What happened next was a surprise. We were woken in the middle of the night by the night clerk and he insisted that we tell him then and now whether we wanted the bed for the remainder of our stay. I don't know if the staff had contacted management or decided to do this on their own, but there certainly wasn't any need to do this in the middle of the night. We were unable to go to back to sleep and that is why I'm writing this review now. I think this treatment by the staff mars an otherwise nice hotel and would keep me from recommending this hotel or returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem in great location”
Reviews.Author: TWBuddy
Reviews.Content: A very nice boutique hotel in a very handy location. We had a lovely room overlooking a square, slightly to the right. It looks plain from the outside but is very nice inside. Very tiny pool which we did not use due to weather, but nice outside deck.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dhanson358
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few days before taking a cruise out of Barcelona. The hotel is in a perfect location, right near everything in the old city. Walking distance to plenty of great sites, and also very close to several subway stops if you need to go farther. Also a very cheap cab ride to the cruise ship port. The rooms were clean, service was very nice, and the rates quite reasonable. Only one complaint really: no alarm clock (or clock of any kind) in the room. Seemed a bit odd. Otherwise, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy”
Reviews.Author: Welat000
Reviews.Content: Good location - easy walking distance to bars, restaurants, shops, etc. Friendly staff. Good sized rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: CodyDC
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in good location - easy walking distance to heart of Gothic quarter with the Cathedral and few blocks to Metro. Reaching the airport via Aerobus or Train is easy since both Train station and aerobus stop is a couple subway stops away on same line. The hotel is also near the waterfront and nice evening walk along the promenade. Using the Barcelona Card is a must - for getting around with the subway and discount admissions to places of interest. The hotel has free wifi in the room - so could use my iphone which was a plus. Room also had large shower which was nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Flapzter
Reviews.Content: The hotel was worth every euro we paid for it. Very close to the Ramblas (and by close we mean 5 minutes leisure-walk) but also ideal for those who will take a cruise-boat from Barcelona (as we did) because it's very close to the port as well! The rooms are very trendy and we even got an inside kind-of balcony with love-seat. The bathrooms are very clean and have both a normal as well as a rain-shower. Our only minus-points to give is to the hotel-restaurant which looks nice but the food is served cold and isn't very exiting. Last tip don't spend money on the breakfast, there is a lovely bakery 2 minutes from the hotel where the serve very good food and coffee for less than half of the hotel-breakfast price!

Reviews.Title: “I would confidently recommend this hotel to family and friends.”
Reviews.Author: b0uncer
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel quite highly and would re-visit if the opportunity arose. Reception staff were friendly and professional, room was spacious and clean, and the food was varied and plentiful. Dining area was frequently unattended however, and this resulted in a lack of tea/coffee reservoir, often for several minutes. After one intense period of torrential rain, one bedside locker and bathroom sink were invaded by an army of ants ... we dealt with this situation without complaint. Management should advertise the location more ... our taxi driver abandoned us (near the hotel) claiming that he could not find the building. Pickpockets will do incredible long-term damage to the reputation of this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Catalonia Port”
Reviews.Author: Sue11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on a quiet street a stones throw away from La Ramblas, close to the port. It is newly built I believe in 2007 and this shows in the decor finished in wood, glass and slate. We arrived in the evening and checked in. The reception, whilst not rude are not the most friendly of staff and I wonder how good their customer service would be if they had to deal with any problems. We finished checking in and went up to our room. After the usual wrangling with trying to get the electronic key to unlock the door (is it just us or does this happen to everyone?!) we went into our room. Whilst not huge, this was very nicely furnished with a polished black tiled floor, wooden decor, nice large flat screen tv. The bed was attractive with white linen and decorative pillows on the bed. It had a dark brown satin throw on the bottom to complete the effect. The throw had a dirty mark on it and I turned it over to find a clean side, unfortunately the other side was even dirtier! I wonder why this is not cleaned on a regular basis as it spoilt the luxury touch of the bedding? The bathroom was very nice with granite and wood furniture and a modern bath and shower. I am very fussy so inspected the corners for dirt and unfortunately found a bit of a lack of cleaning by the hotel staff! Overall the room was clean though. As it was getting late in the evening we decided to eat in the hotel restaurant and were very pleasantly surprised by the quality and cheap price of the set menu, altough I prefer to eat out rather than in a hotel, I would recommend that others try the restaurant at least once. Our room looked out onto a side street with offices on the other side, there was no noise coming into the room from the street at all and we enjoyed uninterruped sleep in the comfortable bed. The outside pool area was very nice with wooden decking and lovely deep comfortable chairs, it is very small though the pool is not really big enough to swim in but would be good to dip into to cool off in on a hot day. All in all I would definately recommend this hotel as a good place to stay. The only reservations I would state are the not overly friendly reception staff and the fact that a bit of dirt was starting to build up in the corners of the rooms and the dirty bed throw, whilst the place is new this is not a major problem, but it may start to look a bit shabby as the years go on if this is not rectified. I would be happy to return to this hotel on a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice! Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: SDSpartan
Reviews.Content: Did much research on staying in Barcelona. Several of the hotels we first desired where sold out. Found this hotel via TA and the recommendations. I would stay here again without hestitation. The price was not only right, but the room and hotel were lovely, new, modern and clean. We had a 3rd floor room facing the street. It was quiet. There are double doors to the balcony, which do open, but when closed, you do not hear any noise. The room was nice, laminate floors, minimalist decor. Flat screen TV. Nice closet and hallway, which helps with eliminating the noise from the hallway outside. The bathroom was nice - marble and granite, nice shower and sink/counter space. Nice check-in - though our room was not ready when we arrived - though no surpise since it was 10 am in the morning. They held our luggage and off we went. There is a hotel bar and restaurant - both looked nice, but we did not partake. There is lounge/deck and pool area, which is nice, though small. The location - is excellent. I was somewhat worried the location would be "iffy" - not at all, Felt safe walking around at night. There are many bars/tapas and restaurants in the area - several on the Ample street (hotel street) and several more on the street which is one block closer to the Port/main street. There is also a church nearby. YOu are about 1 and 1/2 blocks from the end of the Ramblas. Very convenient. We enjoyed the many tapas bars nearby and there is also several small markets nearby (within 1/2 block) and a pastry shop too. We walked all over the place from this location and felt safe. We took a bus from the airport to Plc Catalunya and then a taxi from there to the hotel. It cost about $5 Euros for the taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelor12
Reviews.Content: I went with a friend to Barcelona and did know what to expect when we got to the hotel. I was pleasantly surprised. It was on a quiet street, within a stone's throw of Las Ramblas and so many other great locations. The staff was very nice, the room was clean and a decent size. The bathroom was large, with good water pressure in the shower and plenty of room. The air condition in the room was great and much needed, as it was in the nineties while we were there. It's a nice hotel: clean, quiet, centrally located, with nice accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great central hotel”
Reviews.Author: KarinaNorway
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of the Gothic quarter. A few steps away from the port, Las Ramblas and all central facilities. The hotel is almost brand new and looks great. The style is a kind of "warm minimalistic" with beautiful details. Our room was big and clean. The bed was very large and comfy. Breakfast was good and the service in the reception was friendly. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Just what you need”
Reviews.Author: Caheragh
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights. The outside belies what's through the doors. An old Spanish house that opens into a very smart and modern hotel with excellent facilities, service and in a perfect location. It was converted in 2008 and is very up to date with a modern decor. The rooms are very clean and comfortable and the bathroom has very good showers and fitments. How many hotels provide a comb? It is located 200 metres from the bottom of La Rambla and 20m metres from the road alongthe sea front area. Taxis are cheap and you can everywhere from here. The staff were extremely helpful and provided whatever info we needed to know. The breakfast is a buffet with good choice and on a 10 Euro promotion when we were there instead of the advertised 16 which I don't think everyone realised so check if you go. It was just noted in the lift. I stay in hotels quite a lot on business. Usually I can find something to criticise or annoy me but not here.

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Port
HotelInfo.Address: Carrer Ample, 1 | Pl Duc de Medinaceli, 08002 Barcelona, Spain
